query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Già era l’angel dietro a noi rimaso, 2 l’angel che n’avea vòlti al sesto giro, 3 avendomi dal viso un colpo raso;
query.error: **English:** 1 Now the angel had remained behind us, 2 the angel who had turned us to the sixth circle, 3 after erasing a mark from my face;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 e quei c’hanno a giustizia lor disiro 5 detto n’avea beati, e le sue voci 6 con ‘sitiunt’, sanz’ altro, ciò forniro.
query.error: **English:** 4 and he had called blessed those who have their desire for justice, 5 and his words 6 ended with ‘sitiunt’, and nothing else.
query.result: 4 and þa þe habbað to rihtwisnesse heora wilnunge 5 he hæfde gecweden eadige, and his word 6 mid ‘sitiunt’, butan oðrum, þæt geendode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 E io più lieve che per l’altre foci 8 m’andava, sì che sanz’ alcun labore 9 seguiva in sù li spiriti veloci;
query.error: **English:** 7 And I, lighter than through the other circles, 8 went on, so that without any labor 9 I followed the swift spirits upward;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 quando Virgilio incominciò: «Amore, 11 acceso di virtù, sempre altro accese, 12 pur che la fiamma sua paresse fore;
query.error: **English:** 10 when Virgil began: "Love, 11 kindled by virtue, always kindles another, 12 provided that its flame appears outwardly;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 onde da l’ora che tra noi discese 14 nel limbo de lo ’nferno Giovenale, 15 che la tua affezion mi fé palese,
query.error: **English:** 13 whence from the hour that Juvenal descended among us 14 into the limbo of hell, 15 who made your affection manifest to me,
query.result: 13 ðanon of ðam timan ðe Iuvenalis niðerastah 14 on ða helle grund, 15 se ðe ðine lufe me cyðde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 mia benvoglienza inverso te fu quale 17 più strinse mai di non vista persona, 18 sì ch’or mi parran corte queste scale.
query.error: **English:** 16 my goodwill toward you was such 17 as never bound me more closely to an unseen person, 18 so that now these stairs seem short to me.
query.result: 16 min welwillan ongean ðe wæs swylc 17 swa næfre fæstor me gebunden nære 18 to ungesewenum men,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Ma dimmi, e come amico mi perdona 20 se troppa sicurtà m’allarga il freno, 21 e come amico omai meco ragiona:
query.error: **English:** 19 But tell me, and as a friend forgive me 20 if too much boldness loosens my rein, 21 and as a friend now reason with me:
query.result: 19 Ac sege me, and swa ðu freond eart, forgif me 20 gif ðin ofermod ðinne brydel toðeonað, 21 and swa ðu freond nu mid me spræce:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 come poté trovar dentro al tuo seno 23 loco avarizia, tra cotanto senno 24 di quanto per tua cura fosti pieno?».
query.error: **English:** 22 how could avarice find a place within your breast, 23 among so much wisdom, 24 of which through your care you were so full?
query.result: 22 hu mihte ðin sefa innan ðinum bosme 23 findan gefean, ðurh ðone miclan wisdom 24 ðe ðu ðurh ðine gime ða geworht hæfdest?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Queste parole Stazio mover fenno 26 un poco a riso pria; poscia rispuose: 27 «Ogne tuo dir d’amor m’è caro cenno.
query.error: **English:** 25 These words made Statius smile 26 a little at first; then he replied: 27 "Every word you say about love is a dear sign to me.
query.result: 25 Þas word Stace seonunga bæron 26 lythwon on hleahtor; ða he eft ongan 27 andswaru secgan: "Æghwylc ðinra word

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Veramente più volte appaion cose 29 che danno a dubitar falsa matera 30 per le vere ragion che son nascose.
query.error: **English:** 28 Truly, many times things appear 29 that give false cause for doubt 30 because of the true reasons that are hidden.
query.result: 28 Soðlice oft gesewen bið ðæt ðing 29 ðe ðone geleafan lease gebringð 30 ðurh ða soðan gescead ðe syndon digle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 La tua dimanda tuo creder m’avvera 32 esser ch’i’ fossi avaro in l’altra vita, 33 forse per quella cerchia dov’ io era.
query.error: **English:** 31 Your question confirms your belief 32 that I was miserly in the other life, 33 perhaps because of that circle where I was.
query.result: 31 ðin bøn ðin geleafa mæðeð 32 ðæt ic wæs gitsere on ðam oðrum life, 33 mægðan be ðam rince ðær ic wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Or sappi ch’avarizia fu partita 35 troppo da me, e questa dismisura 36 migliaia di lunari hanno punita.
query.error: **English:** 34 Now know that avarice was 35 driven too far from me, and this excess 36 has been punished for thousands of moons.
query.result: 34 Nu ðu scealt witan ðæt ðeos unrihtwisnes wæs 35 to ðam micle fram me afyrred, and ðeos ofermæð 36 ðusenda monða ðurh ða wræce ðrowode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 E se non fosse ch’io drizzai mia cura, 38 quand’ io intesi là dove tu chiame, 39 crucciato quasi a l’umana natura:
query.error: **English:** 37 And if I had not directed my attention, 38 when I heard you calling there, 39 almost angry with human nature:
query.result: 37 And gif ic ða ne gymde mines modes, 38 ða ic ðær gehyrde ðær ðu clypodest, 39 yrre geworden neah ðære menniscan gecynde:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 ‘Per che non reggi tu, o sacra fame 41 de l’oro, l’appetito de’ mortali?’, 42 voltando sentirei le giostre grame.
query.error: **English:** 40 ‘Why do you not restrain, O sacred hunger 41 for gold, the appetite of mortals?’, 42 turning back I would have felt the bitter jousts.
query.result: 40 ‘Hwi ne gestillest ðu, ðu halige gytsung, 41 ðara deadlicra manna modes lust?’, 42 on bæc gewend ic ða graman gesceaft funde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Allor m’accorsi che troppo aprir l’ali 44 potean le mani a spendere, e pente’mi 45 così di quel come de li altri mali.
query.error: **English:** 43 Then I realized that spreading my wings too much 44 could cause my hands to fail, and I repented 45 of that as well as of my other sins.
query.result: 43 Þa ic onfand ðæt to ðæs micle up 44 ða handa mæg ðurh ðone fleog spreotan, and ic me ðæs ongan 45 ofþincan swa ðæs oðres yfeles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Quanti risurgeran coi crini scemi 47 per ignoranza, che di questa pecca 48 toglie ’l penter vivendo e ne li stremi!
query.error: **English:** 46 How many will rise up with shorn hair 47 through ignorance, which takes away 48 the repentance for this sin while living and at the end!
query.result: 46 Hu mænige arisað mid scearede loccum 47 ðurh unræd, ðe ðisse synne 48 ðone hreoweð forðnimð lifgende and æt ðam endum!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 E sappie che la colpa che rimbecca 50 per dritta opposizione alcun peccato, 51 con esso insieme qui suo verde secca;
query.error: **English:** 49 And know that the fault which rebukes 50 a sin directly opposed to it, 51 dries up its greenness here together with it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 però, s’io son tra quella gente stato 53 che piange l’avarizia, per purgarmi, 54 per lo contrario suo m’è incontrato».

query.result: 52 forðy, gif ic wæs betwux ðam folce 53 ðe bewepað ðone gitsunge, ðurh ðæt ic me geclænsige, 54 ðurh ðæs andsæte me is gelimpen».

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Se così è, qual sole o quai candele 62 ti stenebraron sì, che tu drizzasti 63 poscia di retro al pescator le vele?».

query.result: 61 Gif hit swa is, hwæt sunne oððe hwæt leoht 62 ðe forstærde swa ðæt ðu on bæc gewendest 63 ðine segl æfter ðam fiscere?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Ed elli a lui: «Tu prima m’invïasti 65 verso Parnaso a ber ne le sue grotte, 66 e prima appresso Dio m’alluminasti.
query.error: **English:** 64 And he to him: "You first invited me 65 to Parnassus to drink at its springs, 66 and then you enlightened me next to God.
query.result: 64 And he to him: "Þu ær me lærðest 65 To Parnaso, þæt ic þær sceolde 66 Drincan of ðinum burnan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Facesti come quei che va di notte, 68 che porta il lume dietro e sé non giova, 69 ma dopo sé fa le persone dotte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 quando dicesti: ‘Secol si rinova; 71 torna giustizia e primo tempo umano, 72 e progenïe scende da ciel nova’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Per te poeta fui, per te cristiano: 74 ma perché veggi mei ciò ch’io disegno, 75 a colorare stenderò la mano.
query.error: **English:** 73 For you I was a poet, for you a Christian: 74 but so that you may see what I am planning, 75 I will stretch out my hand to paint.
query.result: 73 For ðe wæs ic scop, for ðe wæs ic Cristen: 74 ac ðæt ðu geseo ðæt ic ðence, 75 ic wille hentan ða heowe.

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Già era ’l mondo tutto quanto pregno 77 de la vera credenza, seminata 78 per li messaggi de l’etterno regno;

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 e la parola tua sopra toccata 80 si consonava a’ nuovi predicanti; 81 ond’ io a visitarli presi usata.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Vennermi poi parendo tanto santi, 83 che, quando Domizian li perseguette, 84 sanza mio lagrimar non fur lor pianti;

85 e mentre che di là per me si stette, 86 io li sovvenni, e i lor dritti costumi 87 fer dispregiare a me tutte altre sette.

query.result: 85 and ða ða he ðær ðurh me wunode, 86 ic him ða fultumode, and heora rihte ðeawas 87 ða forhogodon me ealle oðre.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

91 lungamente mostrando paganesmo; 92 e questa tepidezza il quarto cerchio 93 cerchiar mi fé più che ’l quarto centesmo.

query.prompt:

query.prompt:

97 dimmi dov’ è Terrenzio nostro antico, 98 Cecilio e Plauto e Varro, se lo sai: 99 dimmi se son dannati, e in qual vico».

query.result: 97 sege me hwær is Terentius ure ealde, 98 Caecilius and Plautus and Varro, gif ðu ðæt wast: 99 sege me gif ða syndon forðemde, and on hwylcum wicum».

query.prompt:

100 «Costoro e Persio e io e altri assai», 101 rispuose il duca mio, «siam con quel Greco 102 che le Muse lattar più ch’altri mai,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 nel primo cinghio del carcere cieco; 104 spesse fïate ragioniam del monte 105 che sempre ha le nutrice nostre seco.
query.error: **English:** 103 in the first circle of the sightless prison; 104 often we speak of the mountain 105 that always keeps our nurses with it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Euripide v’è nosco e Antifonte, 107 Simonide, Agatone e altri piùe 108 Greci che già di lauro ornar la fronte.
query.error: **English:** 106 Euripides is here with us, and Antiphon, 107 Simonides, Agathon, and others more, 108 Greeks who once adorned their brows with laurel.
query.result: 106 Euripides is her mid us and Antiphon, 107 Simonides, Agathon, and other mo, 108 Greeks ðe whilom laurel did on ðæm brede.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Quivi si veggion de le genti tue 110 Antigone, Deïfile e Argia, 111 e Ismene sì trista come fue.
query.error: **English:** 109 There are seen of your people 110 Antigone, Deiphile, and Argia, 111 and Ismene as sad as she was.
query.result: 109 Þær mon mæg geseon of ðinum folce 110 Antigone, Deïfile, and Argia, 111 and Ismene swiðe unblide swa heo wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Védeisi quella che mostrò Langia; 113 èvvi la figlia di Tiresia, e Teti, 114 e con le suore sue Deïdamia».
query.error: **English:** 112 You can see her who showed Langia; 113 there is the daughter of Tiresias, and Thetis, 114 and Deidamia with her sisters.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Tacevansi ambedue già li poeti, 116 di novo attenti a riguardar dintorno, 117 liberi da saliri e da pareti;
query.error: **English:** 115 Both poets were now silent, 116 once again attentive to looking around, 117 free from climbing and from walls;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 e già le quattro ancelle eran del giorno 119 rimase a dietro, e la quinta era al temo, 120 drizzando pur in sù l’ardente corno,
query.error: **English:** 118 and already four handmaidens of the day 119 were left behind, and the fifth was at the chariot pole, 120 still raising its burning horn on high,
query.result: 118 and wæron ða feower ðæs dæges ðenan 119 æfter faran, and seo fifte wæs on temo, 120 drihtende ða gyt ðone hatan horn,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 quando il mio duca: «Io credo ch’a lo stremo 122 le destre spalle volger ne convegna, 123 girando il monte come far solemo».
query.error: **English:** 121 when my guide said: "I believe that at the edge 122 we must turn our right shoulders, 123 going around the mountain as we are accustomed to doing."
query.result: 121 ða cwæð min latteow: "Ic wene ðæt we nu 122 ða swiðran eaxle sceolon wendan, 123 ymb ðone munt faran swa we ær dydon."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Così l’usanza fu lì nostra insegna, 125 e prendemmo la via con men sospetto 126 per l’assentir di quell’ anima degna.
query.error: **English:** 124 Thus custom was our guide there, 125 and we took our way with less suspicion 126 because of the assent of that worthy soul.
query.result: 124 Swa wæs ðær ðeaw ðæt us gewissode, 125 and we ða wei ongunnon wendan 126 ðurh ðæs ðegnes word ðe us ðær wel lærde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Elli givan dinanzi, e io soletto 128 di retro, e ascoltava i lor sermoni, 129 ch’a poetar mi davano intelletto.
query.error: **English:** 127 They went in front, and I alone 128 behind, and I listened to their words, 129 which gave me the intellect to make poetry.
query.result: 127 Hie ða forð gewendon, and ic ana æfter, 128 and ða heora spræce hlyste, 129 ða ðe me to ðam wyrce gleawne geteodon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Ma tosto ruppe le dolci ragioni 131 un alber che trovammo in mezza strada, 132 con pomi a odorar soavi e buoni;
query.error: **English:** 130 But soon the sweet discourse was broken off 131 by a tree that we found in the middle of the road, 132 with apples that smelled sweet and good;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 e come abete in alto si digrada 134 di ramo in ramo, così quello in giuso, 135 cred’ io, perché persona sù non vada.
query.error: **English:** 133 and as a fir tree tapers upward 134 from branch to branch, so this one tapered downward, 135 I believe, so that no one could climb it.
query.result: 133 and swa ðæt fyrren treow on ufe weox 134 of lim to lim, swa ðæt on niðer weox, 135 ic wene, forðæm ðe ðær nan mon up ne stige.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Dal lato onde ’l cammin nostro era chiuso, 137 cadea de l’alta roccia un liquor chiaro 138 e si spandeva per le foglie suso.
query.error: **English:** 136 On the side where our path was blocked, 137 a clear stream fell from the high rock 138 and spread over the leaves above.
query.result: 136 On ðære healfe ðær ure weg wæs belocen, 137 feoll of ðære hean stan a wæter cleoru, 138 and hit tosprang ofer ða leafu ufan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Li due poeti a l’alber s’appressaro; 140 e una voce per entro le fronde 141 gridò: «Di questo cibo avrete caro».
query.error: **English:** 139 The two poets approached the tree; 140 and a voice from within the leaves 141 cried out: "You will hold this food dear."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 Poi disse: «Più pensava Maria onde 143 fosser le nozze orrevoli e intere, 144 ch’a la sua bocca, ch’or per voi risponde.
query.error: **English:** 142 Then she said: "Mary thought more about where 143 the honorable and complete wedding 144 could be, than about her own mouth, which now answers for you.
query.result: 142 ða cwæð heo: "Marïa ma þohte mare 143 hwær ða gifta wæron orlegh and eall, 144 ðonne ðin muð, ðe nu ðurh ðe andwyrdeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
145 E le Romane antiche, per lor bere, 146 contente furon d’acqua; e Danïello 147 dispregiò cibo e acquistò savere.
query.error: **English:** 145 And the ancient Romans, for their drinking, 146 were content with water; and Daniel 147 scorned food and acquired knowledge.
query.result: 145 And ða ealdan Rómware, for heora beore, 146 wæron ðæs wætres geblissade; and Daniel 147 forhogode mete and ða ða gleawnesse geceas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
148 Lo secol primo, quant’ oro fu bello, 149 fé savorose con fame le ghiande, 150 e nettare con sete ogne ruscello.
query.error: **English:** 148 The first age, when gold was beautiful, 149 made acorns tasty with hunger, 150 and every stream nectar with thirst.
query.result: 148 Se forma ða æreste, ða gold wæs god, 149 worhte ða ða acorna wynsume mid hungre, 150 and æghwylc burna beorma mid þurste.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
151 Mele e locuste furon le vivande 152 che nodriro il Batista nel diserto; 153 per ch’elli è glorïoso e tanto grande
query.error: **English:** 151 Honey and locusts were the food 152 that nourished the Baptist in the desert; 153 therefore he is glorious and so great

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
154 quanto per lo Vangelio v’è aperto».
query.error: **English:** 154 as is revealed to you by the Gospel.
query.result: 154 swa ðurh ðæt Godspell eow is open.
